meanings.definition: A class of organic compounds containing a carbonyl group bonded to a hydrogen atom and an R group.
meanings.sent1: An aldehyde is a type of organic compound with a special group attached.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study aldehydes to understand their unique chemical properties.
meanings.sent3: The aldehyde molecule decided to invite the carbonyl group to a party.
meanings.sent4: The aldehyde stood out in the chemical reaction like a bright star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: When you see an aldehyde, think of a hydrogen atom holding hands with a carbonyl group.

meanings.definition: Any of a class of highly reactive chemical compounds formed by the oxidation of alcohols.
meanings.sent1: When an alcohol changes, it can become an aldehyde, a reactive compound.
meanings.sent2: Chemists handle aldehydes with caution due to their reactivity.
meanings.sent3: The aldehyde and the alcohol had a heated argument about who was more reactive.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like aldehydes, reacting strongly with everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The aldehyde's reactivity was like a spark igniting a fire in the lab.
